environment.GUI

Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • environment.GUI.UserInterface

  • public class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides the functionality and creates a User interface that takes inputs from the user checks if they are viable for the solution and then sends them to the simulator to accurately represent what the user wants.
    Version:
    21/03/2017
    Author:
    David_Wightman
    See Also:
    getNumberOfPumps(), getNumberOfTills(), getP(), getQ(), getTickCount(), getView()

      private static class  UserInterface.variableType

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserInterface()
      Constructs a new UserInterface by initialising the private variables and then creating frames with which to store them on as well as formatting and organising these frames.Also creates action listeners allowing the window to detect when the user is ready to submit values to the SimulatorView.

      Retrieves the value of trucks from the UserInterface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserInterface

        public UserInterface()
        Constructs a new UserInterface by initialising the private variables and then creating frames with which to store them on as well as formatting and organising these frames.Also creates action listeners allowing the window to detect when the user is ready to submit values to the SimulatorView.

    • Method Detail

      • submit

        private void submit()
        Handles values from the UserInterface and sets them to the private variables whilst also handling errors caused by user entries the system cannot handle. Also creates an error message to warn users that entered values may not be acceptable and then calls the dispose command.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Removes and destroys the visual element of the UserInterface

        public boolean isReady()
        Retrieves the value of isReady from the UserInterface.

      • getView

        public SimulatorView<Station> getView()
        Handles the view setting chosen by the user sent from the UserInterface nulls the current view and then sets view to be in accordance with the new value.
        Returns:
        SimulatorView
